channel.title: I Got A Question for All Senior Coders
channel.description:
Alright, I've been searching on how to do the following thing:
[b]Changing the color of crowns for Mods, Admins and/or Staff.[/b]
I've had no luck, so I'm finally asking. How do I do this?

item.title: I Got A Question for All Senior Coders
item.dc:creator: @rs_w00dcut rs w00dcut
item.description:
@rs_w00dcut wrote:

Senior,Junior,Cba to post.
All means nothing about your java experience.

Read full topic
item.source: I Got A Question for All Senior Coders

item.title: I Got A Question for All Senior Coders
item.dc:creator: @barkingdogc barkingdogc
item.description:
@barkingdogc wrote:

if you have more usefull post that shows you have learnd things and you have been around for awhile
of course sometime typing spam will get up there post but posting something usefull like lets say a help thread and they learn something they will get post and learn more

Read full topic
item.source: I Got A Question for All Senior Coders

item.title: I Got A Question for All Senior Coders
item.dc:creator: @dog_eats_dog dog eats dog
item.description:
@dog_eats_dog wrote:

Both of you, Quit it, JK is right, Rep is pointless and So is senior member being more advanced then Juniors, But luckily in this case, He asked for Experienced Coders (Senior Coders) Not post count.

And to answer this guys question, Do what sasquiotch said:

sasquiotch:

get a client and edit the sprites

Read full topic
item.source: I Got A Question for All Senior Coders

item.title: I Got A Question for All Senior Coders
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

Senior member can be obtained by posting. You need a vertain amount of post count for that. If you keep posting, but no helpful posts. You will soon get Senior member. So it DOESNT matter really… Rep doesn’t matter because people rep for no reason… Or for something as small as telling them to add a “;”
because they forgot it.

Read full topic
item.source: I Got A Question for All Senior Coders

Tanx.
